intro: Prosaptia negrosensis, commonly known as the Negros spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas of lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
